metadata.title: CVE-2020-6422 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in WebGL in Google Chrome prior to 80.0.3987.149 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
